website_summaries.verdict: This propane tank gauge consists of high-quality materials, providing an important level of safety.
pros: Gauge has colors that can be clearly read from a distance
Works with most common connection type
Solid brass construction in the gauge ensures it will give you a long-lasting performance
cons: A slightly higher price than some other gauges with a single valve

customer_reviews.title: The gauge restricts the flow of propane
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used the gauge it didn’t show the tank was running out of propane until the very last minute. Next thing I knew the grill was no longer lit. I decided it may have been a fluke so I gave it another try. The second time the gauge seemed to work to properly but the grill started to get cooler as I was cooking. I noticed the flame was very low even though I had it turned to high. I removed the gauge and relit the grill. The flame immediately returned to normal. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: HMW

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: This device only tells you that there is gas in the tank. It does NOT message how much gas there is. I tried three different tanks (25%, 50%, and 100% full) all three read the exact same, right in the middle of Green "GAS" field. Basically, it's just telling you there's gas in the tank. I expected (like I'm sure most do) that it would move within the Green but it does not. The close to empty (25% or less tank) and just fill and never uses (100%) tank read the same as the half-full one, again so I'm clear, right in the middle of Green "GAS" field on the gauge.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Medugno

customer_reviews.title: We all need these
customer_reviews.text: My old LP tanks had gauges built in and I never had any surprises. We just upgraded to a new RV though and the new tanks don't have gauges so I bought two of these. These are perfect. There are so many systems to keep track of on your RV and the last thing you need is a surprise from empty LP tanks. These gauges only register when the valves are turned on and the system is pressurized. Sometimes I get a false empty reading, but if I turn on a burner and start the fuel running it will show the accurate reading again. The price and quality of these gauges are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Edmiston

customer_reviews.title: BBQ Propane Tank Gauge
customer_reviews.text: Great BBQ propane gauge. Takes the guess work out of knowing how much fuel is left in the tank. I bought this for my propane powered smoker and due to needing to smoke meat for hours, I needed to know how much fuel was left in the tank. Gauge works well and is accurate. The gauge did not restrict any flow of propane like I have seen others mention. Definitely a must have item for any propane grill or smoker.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie J

customer_reviews.title: Good pressure gauge
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to know how much was left on the propane tank on my barbecue and needed a pressure gauge. Picked the Astor Propane Tank pressure gauge based on reviews. It attached very easily to my tank and then the hose from the burners to the other end of the gauge. It does show me there is propane in the tank when turned on and it does go back to empty after tank is turned off after a short while. I can't say how accurate it is, but will update review as needed.
customer_reviews.author: LuigiTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate gauge, a waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: Did not work. Placed it on full 20 lb propane tank. It measured about 3/4 full. I didn't know if tank was not as full as it was supposed to be or gauge was not accurate. Next day, the gauge was in the "low gas" range. I removed the tank to have it refilled but, when weighed, it was still nearly full. This gauge created a stressful situation and it is a piece of garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: This gauge has stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I had people over for grilling and this gauge shows empty! I was shocked as I had just filled the tank. Turns out that it was the gauge. Took it off and gas was flowing. Either the gauge is blocking the gas or it got contaminated pretty quickly. I have stopped using it. Otherwise the gauge levels seemed ok but I'm not even sure those were accurate now.
customer_reviews.author: THX1138

customer_reviews.title: Failed within one season
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing. The gage worked well initially, and did the basic job that it was designed to do, however it is not built to be weatherproof for some reason. It had been installed on a propane take that was outside. There must have been a small leak in the seal, because as the season progresses, the rain must have gotten to it, as droplets cajole be seen inside the the gage. Eventually the moisture caused the internal working to rust , which frozen up the indicator, causing it to be completely useless. I can not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Ryan

customer_reviews.title: When it fails, you will think your tank is empty when it is not.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used two of these. I’ve found that that they work beautifully for a year or so and then will suddenly and unexpectedly fail. The tank will be full or nearly full but the gauge will show empty or nearly empty. Furthermore the gauge somehow will restrict the flow of gas from the full tank to the burners making you think the tank is actually really empty when it is not.
customer_reviews.author: SLD

customer_reviews.title: Solved a problem.
customer_reviews.text: This gauge was very reasonably priced and works exactly as they advertised. Received the shipment on time. Easy install and it seems very accurate. Would highly recommend. UPDATE... I just changed out the tank and when I reconnected everything, it leaked. I tried to connect it multiple times and it leaked every time. I finally by passed the gauge and hooked the cylinder up to the grill's regulator and no leaks. No sure what happened and why it leaked after almost a year. Maybe I damaged an o ring or something. Anyway just an update.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good price, easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Good price, easy to install, and gauge is easy to read. Installed in-between the BBQ line and the tank and I can now tell the level of the tank in an instant. The only downside, like others have pointed out, there is no temperature compensation; at the end of the day the tank shows 3/4 full, first thing in the morning the tank reads 1/2 full. Not perfect, but good enough for what I need
customer_reviews.author: James Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: After many, many years of using propane grills and guessing how much propane was remaining in the tank when I started to grill, I finally decided to purchase a tank pressure gauge. I decided on this relatively inexpensive Astor gauge from Amazon and it's terrific. It was very easy to install between the tank and the feed hose. I use it on a Weber grill that has the tank underneath the grill behind closed doors. Before I start to grill, I simply open the door on the grill and assure that the gauge needle is in the "Green" area that indicates that enough propane is still available. This is a great product and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: John G

customer_reviews.title: STOP GUESSING IF YOU HAVE ENOUGH PROPANE FOR GRILLING!!!
customer_reviews.text: This propane tank gauge is a Great addition to my Weber grill. It's takes seconds to put this gauge between your propane tank and your grill. The package arrived in a day or two, and it was properly packaged with care, so that it arrived free of any damage. This is a small MOM AND POP BUSINESS, and I always try to support these types of businesses because they are THE HEART AND SOUL OF AMERICA!!! 👍🤠🇺🇸🇺🇸🇺🇸
customer_reviews.author: Top Doc

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Installed on a newly filled tank on our grill. Opened tank valve and the gage read almost at the end of the green zone. Used the grill twice and the gage now reads almost in the yellow zone. Checked and insured feed lines were tight and tank valve was fully opened, they were. Something is not right, faulty gage? Tank delivered not totally full? Not sure!
customer_reviews.author: tmflorida

customer_reviews.title: A GREAT PRODUCT FOR US
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to install for our patio heater which uses propane gas. We never knew how much propane was left in the tank until we purchased this. Now there is no doubt. Not having lived in cold weather until recently, we learn something new every time a cold front comes through town. We purchased a tall patio heater and were unaware that this wasn't already a part of the heater. Really comes in handy and love having it.
customer_reviews.author: BETTY MCNARY

customer_reviews.title: Not real accurate
customer_reviews.text: Gauge reminds me of those dummy warning lights on your dashboard. Everything is fine until the light comes on then it isn’t fine. It seems to stay in Green and doesn’t budge until you notice your out of gas. Unlike a gas gauge that slowly drops as you use fuel. I don’t find it that useful if I am honest.
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: Don't trust this gauge!  2 gauges, same problems!
customer_reviews.text: It always read green/full and then one night the grill shut off. Turns out it was out of propane. Don't trust this gauge. UPDATE: After seeing this review, the manufacturer emailed me and sent me a new one. Nice gesture but... the second one had the same problem! It always read green until one night... the needle dropped and it ran out in the middle of cooking on Father's Day. What a mess. If it matters, I use this with a Broil King Signet 20 grill.
customer_reviews.author: joeg

customer_reviews.title: Great Gauge at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product because I didn't want to have a second propane tank sitting around just in case the first one ran out of propane. This was easy to install and immediately gave a good reading on content. I will monitor this product over the next few usages to see if it correctly tells me when the propane tank is empty. Unless there is an update to the contrary, I would say that the gauge is very accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Tall Paul

customer_reviews.title: Reduces flow
customer_reviews.text: *update I am increasing my rating because despite it being too late to return it the company refunded me my entire purchase price. I am all for supporting businesses that stand behind their products. We took this camping and put it on our propane tank. When we ran out and went to refill we were shocked to find the tank was still half full! The next time we took the gauge off and were able to use all of the propane in the tank. I only wish I had discovered this before it was too late to return it!
customer_reviews.author: Just a mom

customer_reviews.title: I like knowing how much propane I have left!
customer_reviews.text: This gauge is easy to attach to the tank and then to the hose that feeds the burner on our patio grill. When I open the valve, the gauge immediately registers the pressure in the green zone. I know that the pressure will fall and the needle will drift toward the red zone. Then, before the tank is empty, I can take it to a U-Haul facility near my home where they will fill the tank without emptying it and ensure that I get a full 20 pounds in my tank, not just the 15 pounds that is the guaranteed level for an exchange tank.
customer_reviews.author: Nitpicker3

customer_reviews.title: Know tank needs refilling before it's completely empty.
customer_reviews.text: Just installed so haven't calibrated the gauge. Conventional wisdom says when needle is nearing yellow, it's time to switch tanks; and refill. If that is the case, it beats starting a BBQ or furnace in an RV and running out of fuel.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: dont buy does not work stays in the green all ...
customer_reviews.text: dont buy does not work stays in the green all the time checked it before starting to grill and it was in the green and then my tank ran out of gas and had to Finnish inside. do not buy and i can not return it so im stuck with this junk
customer_reviews.author: Krazy&Retta

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: After I installed the gauge, the needle has moved up slightly up and down the green zone but it never consistently moves lower even after several hours of grilling. I'm pretty sure my tank is a quarter full by now but the gauge still reads almost full. What garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Jack T

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: This actually works pretty well. But you have to keep your eye on it. It tends to show a full tank till you're almost empty. If you see it dropping it's time to refill asap.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Easy Install and works great
customer_reviews.text: Easy Install and works great. I have it on the tank attached to my Patio Heater. the local hardware store tried to sell me the handheld scale one that they said was 100% accurate but i refuse to lift the cover, disconnect the tank and lift it to find out if i am low on gas. This product makes it so eay i lift the tank and look. Would recommend
customer_reviews.author: diane duffy

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Warns me when the tank is getting low, and that's all I need. Tanks supplied with my RV did not have gauges, and getting up in the middle of the night because the heat went out to change the tank over is no fun. Now I can check to see if I'm running low, and switch to a full tank for overnight. I can use the low tank during the day and run out out when cooking or it's daylight instead of never knowing when it will run out. It's not easy to just lift them to see how much is left when they're installed. This solves that problem.
customer_reviews.author: Gus&Erin

customer_reviews.title: Solid but it does go from 1/4 tank to empty faster than you expect
customer_reviews.text: The only thing with this is that it seems to quickly go to empty once it hits the lower limits. I’ve run out when expecting to get a couple more grilling sessions. Not sure if maybe I’m doing something wrong but not sure why that would be.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: It's OK
customer_reviews.text: I've used this gauge on 2 full 40 pound propane tanks. When the tank it is attached to is full it only registers half way in the green. It does register correctly as the fuel runs lower and does register correctly when the tank is empty. Since I bought the gauge to show when the tank was nearing empty it's OK.
customer_reviews.author: Vern Haire

customer_reviews.title: Definitely own one!
customer_reviews.text: I definitely think anyone who has a propane grill should own one. I really thought my propane was out. I still had plenty left. I’m sure I’ve turned in half full propane tanks many times and bought new ones for no reason. Not anymore. This has definitely saved me money and time wondering whether or not I need propane.
customer_reviews.author: Alexsis H

customer_reviews.title: I love everything about it EXCEPT the weight scale for determining ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a Weber Genesis gas grill. I love everything about it EXCEPT the weight scale for determining how much propane I have left in the tank. With some back problems I don't want to lift the tank up and hang it on this. I ordered the Astor (my 2nd one - 1st a few years ago for another grill), and was using it 10 minutes out of the box. Easy to read and seems to be very accurate. I don't expect to run out of gas half way into a cook. Highly recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: Dean Hampton

customer_reviews.title: Easy to
customer_reviews.text: This is easy to read. Easy to install. I’ve used it twice and it has marked on point. Im very Happy with this gauge. I had ordered another brand from Amazon and I had to return it. This is just what we needed for our pit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well. The only accurate way to measure these tanks is by weight.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Really only let's you know when you are close to empty, but that is really why I wanted it. I don't care if I'm full or 1/2 full, I need to know when I'm 30 minutes from empty.
customer_reviews.author: Skinny76

customer_reviews.title: Though it is not a precise measuring instrument it certainly beats picking up and shaking the tank like so many people have been
customer_reviews.text: So far, this gauge works as the seller states. I have gone through only one cycle of filling and discharging the propane tank and it did indicate a somewhat accurate level. It is well made and will probably last for many years. Though it is not a precise measuring instrument it certainly beats picking up and shaking the tank like so many people have been doing over the years. My assessment here is that you will have a very good idea how much propane is left in your tank at all times. If that is your goal then you can buy this one with confidence!
customer_reviews.author: Carol K.

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a similar gauge I had used for years. The meter (readout) is not as large, but plenty big to see all you need to know. Product is well made and for the first month has worked perfectly. Edit - 12/22/16: Left my gauge on a tank that is stored elsewhere, so purchased another one. It is working as perfectly as the others I have had. So much easier than trying to guess howmuch propane is left, or trying to swap a tank in the middle of a cook. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Westside

customer_reviews.title: Great product for use with any portable propane tank.
customer_reviews.text: The product is well made and durable. I bought one of these awhile ago for my propane grill and it not only shows how much propane is in the tank but when you close the valve on the tank it will show when all of the propane is out of the line and safe to shut off the grill. I purchased this gauge for a second propane tank that I hook up to a portable heater for the reasons above and that it is easier to disconnect the hose from the gauge than the tank.
customer_reviews.author: John M

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: My old gauge had died so I bought this as a replacement. I use on a 20 lb tank for a Weber grill. I've had it on for a week and it shows the tank being about 1/2 full which accords with my estimate by lifting the tank.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer from afar

customer_reviews.title: Nice, easy gauge
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Easy to install and the gauge went into the green, which I thought was correct. I have actually bought two of these, one for a friend. It is easy to install and if additional instructions are needed they are easy to find online. Will have to see how accurately the gauge continues to work as the tank becomes slowly empty.
customer_reviews.author: EFreed

customer_reviews.title: This pressure gauge is perfect. I do a lot of grilling and camping
customer_reviews.text: This pressure gauge is perfect. I do a lot of grilling and camping. I do not have to worry about running out of propane when grilling, can quickly take it off and take it camping and not have to worry about running out of propane in the middle of the night while running our heater. I think everybody who has any propane tank for camping and or grilling should have one of these. Thinking of getting another just to keep in my camper. It is a fantastic size, does it job and the price is fantastic.WOW just got my second one, Told you it was great.
customer_reviews.author: Richard B.

customer_reviews.title: pleased
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much exactly what we needed. We live aboard a boat, and running out of cooking gas is no small inconvenience. While the gauge isn't highly precise ( the pressure varies in the tank by temperature) it gives us a fine heads-up as to when we need to seek out a replacement. The piece is cast brass, and solidly made.
customer_reviews.author: Don Elwell

customer_reviews.title: Gauge doesn't tighten onto bottle - leaks fuel
customer_reviews.text: The gauge leaked around the attachment fitting to the tank - I lost about half a bottle of fuel before I discovered the problem. It rotates freely even after being tightened as much as possible.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Gauge arrived in pristine condition in its own packaging in a bubble wrap plastic envelope. The gauge is well made and easy to read. The black knurled nob makes it easy to connect to your tank. When first installed on a 70 degree day, the needle went to the green halfway mark of a full 20 pound tank. On a 78 degree day, the needle went to the 2/3 mark. From previous reviews, I knew that temperature affects the reading before ordering. Happy Camper
customer_reviews.author: RickM46

customer_reviews.title: 😢
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I purchased 2 of these gauges thinking they were same as I had before but not so much. When you connect to a tank that has about 15 minutes of fuel left it shows almost full then goes to red within 5 minutes. The ones I've had before shows full only when I first purchased tank and slowly goes down but unfortunately this gauge goes from full to empty within 5 or 10 minutes! Sorry 😐
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Loftis

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!  Failed after a few months of use.
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY! My grill didn't start up so I brought my propane tank to the hardware store. It was full. I put it back on the grill. It worked. Then it stopped working. It's a poorly made valve that will fail on you when you need it.
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT L.

customer_reviews.title: Great to keep from running out of gas at an in opportune time.
customer_reviews.text: When I originally installed this my gas burners wouldn't get hot enough to cook. I figured that during manufacturing some debris may have gotten into the valve. I took a pressurized air can and blew out all of the orafices and reconnected it. It now works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Carpetbagger

customer_reviews.title: We liked your product cause it solves two issues on safety ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my son in law who has not put his new grill together yet. He was excited to have it. I have forwarded my email to him. We liked your product cause it solves two issues on safety and it was reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: Granny Candy

customer_reviews.title: The key word here is BBQ.
customer_reviews.text: I want a gauge for my RV propane tanks. BBQ 5#, RV 30#. A BBQ gauge will not work on RV. It may be a great BBQ gauge, but will not work on RV.
customer_reviews.author: Jac

customer_reviews.title: It leaked took me a while to figure out why ...
customer_reviews.text: It leaked took me a while to figure out why my fridge ot the trailer would not work. It’s because this thing leaked I happened to be in the right place to smell it
customer_reviews.author: kyle

customer_reviews.title: If you grill this is a must
customer_reviews.text: Life saver when it comes to cooking out on the grill. I remember I ran out of propane one time, but luck for me I was just warming up the grill and did not have any meat set on it yet. I decided to try this product and I can fully say that I am very happy with my purchase as now I can easily see when it is time to go on a refill run instead of playing the guessing game.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: In hindsight I probably don't need this to tell me ...
customer_reviews.text: In hindsight I probably don't need this to tell me how much propane is left in the tank. I can tell by lifting the tank up or by watching the flame withers. But for what it is worth, you can read the propane level with this gauge without doing things said before.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Pan

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love this because was tired of running out of gas
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to love this because was tired of running out of gas...worked when we put it on the tank. Next time the grill would not light with it on. Took it off and grill worked fine..
customer_reviews.author: Fran

customer_reviews.title: Still trying to figure it out.
customer_reviews.text: Vendor pushing for a review less than two weeks after receipt. Initial results are that temperature and altitude seem to have very signifIcant affect on the reading, so need to keep that in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Bought it to convert the inside threads to ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Bought it to convert the inside threads to the easier out threats which can be attached by hand without tools unlike the inter threads on the extended stay hose we installed on our motor home.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly R. Timmerman

customer_reviews.title: Sounds like a BB rattling around inside
customer_reviews.text: Quit working after about 2 weeks. Sounds like a BB rattling around inside. DOES NOT WORK! Update (10-26-17) I tried using my large channel locks to tighten gauge and it now works. However, I still need the wrench to tighten or loosen the gauge.
customer_reviews.author: FLjack

customer_reviews.title: Gauge is not long lasting
customer_reviews.text: This actually stopped working correctly. The needle does not move to a certain point anymore and only had it for one season 4 months
customer_reviews.author: Vic R.

customer_reviews.title: When propane will need refills
customer_reviews.text: Using the gauges on our horse trail propane bottles so we are more secure knowing how much propane we have they both show half so that’s more than we knew before.
customer_reviews.author: t adams

customer_reviews.title: Guage does not give an accurate reading
customer_reviews.text: I have used other brands of propane tank gauges and have been very pleased. I think this one is not as accurate as some of the others. I put it on a tank that I had just had filled and it read in the middle of the green section. So it is registering 1/2 full. I will be curious to see if it gives me an accurate reading as to when it is almost empty. That is the most important reading to me so that I know when I need to fill the tank. I will follow up this review when I have to fill the tank again.
customer_reviews.author: LinBar

customer_reviews.title: Item was faulty, leaked and emptied the propane tank.
customer_reviews.text: The device leaked. I was out in the Eastern Sierras camping and attached the device to my propane tank as to monitor how much propane was being used to run the refrigerator in my RV. The tank had just been filled hours before. When I woke up the next morning the tank was empty and the caution light was flashing on my refrigerator signaling lack of propane. When I attached the secondary propane tank without the device, the propane lasted all week and only used a quarter tank.
customer_reviews.author: Zzoomer

customer_reviews.title: Astor Propane Tank Pressure Gauge
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I are campers and it is not recommended to run out of gas in the middle of the trip. My trailer has twin tanks with a gas level indicator, but it is small and hard to interpret. This gauge is easy to read and interpret. When the first tank runs empty, it is a simple task to move the gauge to the other tank. I am glad I bought this gauge. It is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: John Allen

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: It really helps. I was never to sure how much propane I would have. I feel a lot more confident with this gauge
customer_reviews.author: David Sanford

customer_reviews.title: Useless!
customer_reviews.text: I'm surprised this has so many good reviews, that's why I picked this one. For me the gauge showed full the entire time until the moment the tank was empty. Completely useless.
customer_reviews.author: AZMike

customer_reviews.title: it was pretty good indicator when the propane was full and on ...
customer_reviews.text: it was pretty good indicator when the propane was full and on the low end, but it was showing on the low end of the green and never went to the red before we ran out of propane. Luckily we heard the pilot trying to re-light on the fridge and saw that it had the check light on, so we didn't loose our food. We'll be very careful once the indicator goes to the low end of green.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia A. Chappell

customer_reviews.title: Never Reads Right
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use on a small 1 gallon tank. I used this in very cold weather and the pointer never showed full. Even after several refills and using it in extreme cold and in the desert, the gauge never showed anywhere near full. Bad data is worse than no data at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's a decent gauge for your propane tank
customer_reviews.text: It gives you a decent reading for your propane tank. It'll take the guess work out when it's getting low and needs refilling.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Briggs

customer_reviews.title: Very handy
customer_reviews.text: It's so nice to know when the gas is about to run out. But you have to look at it LOL. My husband ran out during cooking and I said, did you check the gauge?? Unfortunately he checked the gauge only after the grill stopped cooking!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Cooper

customer_reviews.title: you need this gauge
customer_reviews.text: when you connect this gauge to your propane bottle you will be able to see how much fuel you have in the bottle.
customer_reviews.author: alan

customer_reviews.title: Looks like it is going to work.
customer_reviews.text: Installed it yesterday and it appears to work very well. This will be a great help to me if it continues to work.
customer_reviews.author: JJLLBB

customer_reviews.title: No More Guessing
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I used to either guess when a tank was about empty or else run out of gas in the middle of cooking. Yesterday I was going to grill chicken for Memorial Day dinner and the gauge was in the red zone but still indicated gas in the tank. Without the gauge I would have changed out the tank. I grilled my chicken without a problem. I have one gauge on the grill and one on the deck heater. I will be ordering two more for our daughter and son-in-law. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen Svalstad

customer_reviews.title: I have had this product for 5 months. The ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product for 5 months. The gas was on and off 4 to 5 times. Gas on for a total of about 10 days for 3 different trips, (each about 3 days). This last trip my gas to the trailer stopped each night. I went to the gas tank and turned off and on, removed the connection all was ok. Next day, same thing! Removed this product and all was well for the next 3 days, remainder of our trip.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

product_meta.title: Astor Propane Tank Pressure Barbeque Gauge
product_meta.description:
Are you frustrated by propane tanks running empty right as you’re about to cook for friends or family?

Quick: what are the levels of your propane tanks right now?

If you do not know the answer to that, then the barbecue gauge is here to help. Unlike unreliable gauges that might not be safe, or those that require you to lift the whole tank, the gauge gives you a more accurate, color-coded reading—and you don’t even need to bend over to see it.

NO LIFTING | CHECK LEVELS ACCURATELY AND EFFORTLESSLY

Checking your levels has never been easier. Using the easy color guide of the gauge, check out whether you need to replace the tank, whether it’s still got a few uses out of it, or whether you’re all topped up in the blink of an eye.

SAFETY IN TECHNOLOGY

There are some things you can afford to skimp on—safety isn’t one of them. The propane tank gauge conforms to all DOT safety requirements. Its anti-leak detector will also restrict the flow of propane when something goes wrong with your grill or hose.
Your family and friends deserve safety—and you deserve to have it made easy. Order your new barbecue gauge today and enjoy making any activity using propane easy and safe.

We offer a 100% money-back guarantee, but, if our ratings are any indication, you won’t need it. Scroll up and click “Add to Cart” Now!
feature_bullets: CHECK PROPANE LEVELS AT A GLANCE: Never run out of gas again. Simply glance down and know exactly how much is left in the tank, without lifting heavy tanks or straining to see less clear gauges.

UNIVERSAL FIT | NO TOOLS NEEDED: This barbecue gauge goes from package to propane tank without any complicated assembly, tools or pipe thread needed. If your tank or appliance uses a Type-1 connection like most, then the BBQ gauge is perfect.

WHERE TECHNOLOGY AND SAFETY MEET: We minimize the risk any propane tank might bring to your barbecue or RV. The propane tank gauge features all the usual safety perks you’ve come to inspect, and an extra one: an anti-leak detector. If a leak is detected, this gauge restricts the flow to keep you safe.

SOLID BRASS, HIGH-PRECISION METER: Don’t buy something that’s going to break in a year or two. The premium barbecue gauge attaches to your propane tank with high-quality brass and uses the latest in meter technology so that you always get an accurate, reliable read.

ENJOY “THE FULL MEASURE” WITH OUR COMPLETE ONE-YEAR WARRANTY: We trust our sturdy, high-precision barbecue gauges will serve you for years. That’s why we offer a full 12-month warranty. If for whatever reason you’re not happy with any of our products, simply return it to us for a full refund.
